instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3209: What is 820-3209? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: macbook air with short to ground.
threads.message:
I have a macbook air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that turns on and runs, but runs terrible. I've tried several hard drives even external hdds. I when i try to boot into ASD 3s150 o.s. it gives me a circle with a line, but it will boot into the efi version of asd. I noticed the gpu gets really hot, fans on full speed. I did some probing around to find that i have a short to ground on <SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0_VCCIO</SIGNAL> and also on <SIGNAL>PPVCSA_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>. i ran down the <SIGNAL>PPVCSA_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> line to find i have a short in the <SIGNAL>PP1V05_SO_VCCIO</SIGNAL> rail.

Im thinking this could be a problem within the pch but not sure. Any help would be great.

thanks.

threads.title: macbook air with short to ground.
threads.message: Run EFI version of ASD and check for sensor errors

threads.title: macbook air with short to ground.
threads.message: thanks for getting back to me. I did run efi ASD and it passed with no errors. kinda a strange problem. wouldn't think the machine would run with a short to the pch. but i do have a couple different machines that do similar things.

threads.title: macbook air with short to ground.
threads.message: There is no short. It is normal to have a low resistance of a few ohms there. These need to have a working battery connected to work correctly, A1405 battery model.

threads.title: macbook air with short to ground.
threads.message:
i will try with a battery. but when i pulled the components on the <SIGNAL>PPVCSA_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>(except the pch) the pads still had direct connection to ground.
and i pulled them all.

threads.title: macbook air with short to ground.
threads.message: I was able to test the board out with a battery plugged in, same result as before. I guess this might have to go into the donor pile.

threads.title: macbook air with short to ground.
threads.message: What battery? It needs to be a working A1405 battery, must be recognized in OSX.

threads.title: macbook air with short to ground.
threads.message: yep it was an a1405 13" macbook air batter that had 86% charge 281cycle count, normal condition. just strange how the video chip gets super hot but the machine never shuts off is what gets me.
